org.mfg.mdb.compiler

Class Compiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mfg.mdb.compiler.Compiler
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Demo_02_SchemaDefinition

    public class Compiler
extends java.lang.Object

    This is the main class of MDB, use this to define a database schema and compile it.

    You can extend this class and call the schema methods like a script: 

     class Demo {
        Demo() {
                schemaName("Stock");
                packageName("com.stock.mdb");
 
                table("Price");
                column("time", Type.LONG, Order.ASCENDING);
                column("price", Type.LONG);
        }
 
        public static void main(String[] args) {
                Demo demo = new Demo();
                demo.compile("/path/to/demo/source");
        }
 }

    However, if you like to use a visual tool to define and compile the schema you may be interested in the SchemaEditor class.

    Author:
    arian, Antonio de Rojas
    See Also:
    SchemaEditor

      • Compiler

        public Compiler(java.lang.String schemaName,
                java.lang.String sourcesDir,
                java.lang.String packageName,
                int defaultBufferSize)
        Creates a database compiler.
        Parameters:
        schemaName - The schema name. It is used for generate the mdb session class.
        sourcesDir - The source path (usually the 'src' forder) of the target project.
        packageName - The package of the generated classes, for example: com.demo.mdb
        defaultBufferSize - The default buffer size used by cursors and appenders. TODO:Missing reference.

      • schemaName

        public void schemaName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the schema name. Use a valid Java identifier name because this is part of the name of the generated session class. For example, if you set "Foo" then a class FooMDBSession is generated.
        Parameters:
        name - Schema name.

        Parameters:
        bufferSize - The buffer size (number of records of the buffer).

        public void table(java.lang.String name,
                  java.util.UUID id)
        Define a table.
        Parameters:
        name - The table's name. Use a valid Java identifier; in the generated code this name is used as part of methods and classes names.
        id - Unique table id.

        public void table(java.lang.String name)

      • column

        public void column(java.lang.String name,
                   Type type,
                   Order order,
                   boolean virtual,
                   java.lang.String formula,
                   java.util.UUID uuid)
        Define a column. In this example we define the a table A with columns a1, a2, and a table B with columns b1 and b2: 
         table("A");
        column("a1", ...);
        column("a2", ...);
 
 table("B");
        column("b1");
        column("b2");
        Parameters:
        name - The name. Use a valid Java identifier, this one is used as part of methods and fields names in the generated code.
        type - The type.
        order - The order.
        virtual - If the column is virtual.TODO:Missing reference.
        formula - The formula to compute the value, or null in case the column is not virtual.TODO:Missing reference.
        uuid - The unique identifier.

      • column

        public void column(java.lang.String name,
                   Type type,
                   Order order)
        Define a column. Like column(String, Type, Order, boolean, String, UUID) but non virtual and with a random unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        name - The name. Use a valid Java identifier, this one is used as part of methods and fields names in the generated code.
        type - The type.
        order - The order.

      • column

        public void column(java.lang.String name,
                   Type type)
        Define a column. Like column(String, Type, Order, boolean, String, UUID) but without order, non virtual and with a random unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        name - The name. Use a valid Java identifier, this one is used as part of methods and fields names in the generated code.
        type - The type.

      • columnAsc

        public void columnAsc(java.lang.String name,
                      Type type)
        Define an ascending column. Like column(String, Type, Order, boolean, String, UUID) but with order equals to Order.ASCENDING, non virtual and with a random unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        name - The name.
        type - the type (Type.INTEGER, Type.BOOLEAN ...)

      • columnDesc

        public void columnDesc(java.lang.String name,
                       Type type)
        Define a descending column. Like column(String, Type, Order, boolean, String, UUID) but with order equals to Order.ASCENDING, non virtual and with a random unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        name - The name.
        type - The type.

      • compile

        public void compile()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Generate the MDB classes. Be careful, if the file exists they will be overwritten, so do not write custom code on MDB files, unless you respect the "User Code Sections".TODO:Missing reference.
